availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Clark (Warren County, Kentucky, carpenter)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, carpenter. Virginia native. Married to Sarah "Eliza" Grider Clark in Warren County, Kentucky, in 1837. Carpenter in Warren County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Master carpenter in Warren County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860. Died in Warren County on January 17, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 122A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 425.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 856.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 440A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, Film #000164003.
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Kentucky County, District, and Probate Courts, Warren County Wills, Loose Papers for Volume D, 1797-1985.
"John B. Clark (1813-1863)," Find A Grave, Memorial #17001028, accessed September 21, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/17001028.
